title: If Bard is going after dangerous artifacts of power,
body: Would he be going after Ryze's scroll as well?  Or Ezreal's gauntlet?

replies.body:
Ez weapon doesn't seem too dangerous/powerful by itself but surely it would be interesting to see it used either by Azir or Xerath (I do believe that it was ment for one of them to begin).

Ryze scroll instead seems worthy of a seal expecially since Bard doesn't seem to trust ppl of Runeterra.

I think Ryze could be one of the few people Bard is willing to trust. After all he is doing what Bard would do himself: Protect the scroll.

I see no reason why Bard would go for the scroll unless it seems like Ryze can no longer handle the task himself.
{{champion:13}} :"Take this scroll and stick it... some where safe..."
Ryze himself is a pretty powerful man, so I totally agree. Perhaps the two have had dealings in the past...

What he said.  Bard comes in if the balance is threatened. Ryze is keeping the scroll safe, so the universe is not in danger until the caretaker of the scroll is gone and the badguys are about to get their hands on it.

I don't know if bringing the scroll in a battlefield against tons of powerful beings (some of them being from events he wanted to stop at Shurima and SI) who surely are on par (if not superior) to Ryze himself is a good idea at all.

Ppl seem to think that Ryze is somehow more powerful than other champions without anything to bring up to justify it.

Hmm, Protecting the scroll is his task, but is not his only task. If he want's do more than that, he has to take the risk.

It's a calculated risk though. To protect the scroll he doesn't have to defeat those stronger than him, he just has to get away.

Not taking that risk may end up having worse consequences than loosing the scroll.

He decided it himself aswell as the old man in the video decided to protect the orb.


I know gameplay doesn't affect Lore but if it's as you say then each time Ryze gets nearly killed Bard should come, take the scroll and bring it to the stars.
The old man didn't exactly protect the orb, he split a mountain in half after all. And he sounded like he wanted to use it againt the enemy army in the first place.
Bard doesn't sound anyway as some1 who trusts Runetrrans anyway.
or {{champion:103}}'s body, thats a pretty dangerous artifact

Hey! 

This is more so my opinion than narrative fact, but I think Ryze's scroll, although being a dangerous artifact, has yet to be unleashed, and Ezreal's gauntlet has yet to reach its full potential. Think of it in terms of the old man in Bard:Mountain. Ryze is basically like the old man was just holding the egg/moonstone, nothing threatening here. Ezreal is like the old man firing bolts from the artifact to protect himself, not much of a problem here either. It's only when the artifact becomes significantly dangerous, like accidentally cutting a mountain in half, does Bard take full notice.
It wouldn't surprise me if Bard took every item in the shop apart from potions and Doran's items.
{{champion:201}} 's shield - able to stop an infinite damage Veigar ultimate without losing anything more than a little mana.

I think he would go after Ryzes scroll if it was used by someone in a "wrong" way.
However the problem is that Bards definition of right and wrong might not align with Ryzes(or that Ryze thinks that not even bard can keep it safe),so while i think that bard might go after the scroll eventually,I doubt that Ryze is going to give it to him that easily.
